The AI Innovation Express: A One-Day Innovation Sprint
The AI Innovation Express: A One-Day Innovation Sprint

This hands-on programme integrates design thinking and AI to tackle real-world challenges, guiding participants through ideation, prototyping, and creating actionable strategies for fields like the Digital Economy.
Embark on a fast-paced, hands-on journey through design innovation with The AI Innovation Express, where cutting-edge AI integration meets human-centered creativity.

This immersive one-day programme equips learners with the tools and techniques to tackle real-world challenges by combining design thinking principles, AI-driven insights, and interdisciplinary collaboration.

Designed for innovators, professionals, and changemakers, this programme delivers a high-energy sprint where learners learn to navigate complexity, embrace collaboration, and adapt AI-driven approaches to systems thinking and design applications. Whether seeking to advance your career, build better products, or reimagine experiences, this programme offers the tools, mindset, and inspiration to accelerate your innovation journey.

Using a streamlined approach to the 4D framework - Discover, Define, Develop, Deliver, the programme emphasises "learning by doing." Learners will apply AI-enhanced tools to ideate, prototype, and refine solutions in emerging fields such as the Digital Economy, Green Economy, and Industry 4.0. Along the way, they will develop actionable strategies and low-fidelity prototypes, showcasing their ability to integrate AI technologies into sustainable, user-focused solutions.
UX/UI designers, Product designers, Graphic designers, Design managers, Innovation consultants
Business analysts, Strategy managers, Innovation executives, Change management specialists, Business development professionals
Data analysts, AI/ML specialists, Systems engineers, Software developers, Technology strategists
Instructional designers, Educators and academic leaders, Curriculum developers, Learning and Development (L&D) managers
Sustainability officers, Systems thinking experts, Environmental engineers, Circular economy consultants
Digital marketing professionals, Brand managers, Content strategists, Advertising executives
Entrepreneurs, Founders and co-founders, Venture development professionals, Startup advisors
Policy makers, Urban planners, NGO managers, Community development officers
A minimum of a diploma or A-Levels is required, with an undergraduate degree from an IHL being preferred.
Leverage design thinking principles and AI-driven tools to identify and solve real-world challenges, focusing on fields like interaction design, UX/UI design, and product development

Create low-fidelity prototypes and actionable strategies using the 4D framework (Discover, Define, Develop, Deliver), showcasing their ability to integrate innovation and technology into problem-solving
Explore and apply AI-driven insights and data analytics to systems thinking applications, addressing complex problems with sustainable and user-centric approaches
Enhance their teamwork, adaptability, and communication skills by engaging in collaborative sprints, refining ideas through iterative feedback, and presenting innovative solutions
Gain foundational expertise in user experience design, interface design, and sustainability-driven innovation, empowering them to drive impactful change in their industries and careers
Professor, College of Engineering, Design, & Computing, Univ. of Colorado Denver Anschutz Medical Campus
Professor, College of Engineering, Design, & Computing, Univ. of Colorado Denver Anschutz Medical Campus

Dr. Kristin L. Wood is currently a Professor, College of Engineering, Design, & Computing, Univ. of Colorado Denver Anschutz Medical Campus. He was formerly the Senior Assoc. Dean of Innovation and Engagement, Exec. Director of the Comcast Center, & Director of Inworks, as well as leadership roles at UT Austin and the Singapore University of Technology & Design.

Dr. Wood completed his M.S. & Ph.D. degrees, Division of Engineering and Applied Science, California Institute of Technology (Caltech). He leads the development of design strategies, representations, and methods (Design Science) that will result in more comprehensively designed businesses, design tools, innovative products, innovative manufacturing processes, and design teaching aids at the college, K-12, and industrial levels.

Driven by his passion for design and architecture, Xin Yan is committed to exploring its future possibilities and sustainable design. He wants to utilise his skills to create a better world for the future and the masses. With Xin Yan’s knowledge and experience in design and architecture, he is confident he can create innovative solutions that will generate value for any organisation and its customers with his dedication to design and his commitment to sustainable design.

Adya is a Design Innovation Lead with 7 years of experience in product design, experience design, Design Innovation facilitation, leading workshops and content creation. Adya loves to collaborate with various stakeholders on the 0 to 1 process of problem statement to disruptive, innovative prototypes to test with users. Art, communication and creating content is a passion she intends to pursue for many years to come. Looking for collaborations, partnerships and meaningful projects to contribute to.
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who:
Attend at least 75% of the course
Undertake and pass non-credit bearing assessment during the course
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.
Assessment Type: Project, Demonstration and Oral Questioning

Learners will work in teams to tackle a real-world problem using the 4D framework (Discover, Define, Develop, Deliver). The project concludes with a prototype, presentation, and final report. They will pitch their solutions to assessors, showcasing their prototypes and decision-making process. Facilitators and assessors will engage in a Q&A to evaluate understanding, rationale, and application of workshop concepts.
The full fee for this course is S$1,308.00.
Funded under SkillsFuture Mid-Career Enhanced Subsidy (MCES)
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
